Latin (1890) Triglot Bible (Heb Greek Latin)

The Triglot Bible, published in 1890 by R.D. Dickinson, is a comprehensive compilation of the Holy Scriptures of the Old and New Testaments. This edition uniquely presents the texts in their original languages—Hebrew for the Old Testament, Greek for the New Testament—alongside the Septuagint (Greek translation of the Old Testament), the Syriac version of the New Testament, and the Latin Vulgate. These texts are arranged in parallel columns, offering a comparative study of the scriptures across different linguistic and cultural interpretations. The publication includes a complete prolegomenon, providing valuable insights and scholarly context. This Triglot Bible is an important resource for biblical scholars, linguists, and those interested in the textual analysis and historical study of the Bible.
